title: Project-Based Learning Design for Higher Education Using 4G Technology (K-12)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mobile device usage experience and understanding of core social studies concepts at the middle school level
context.additional_context: Flexible learning space configuration utilizing 4G network environments and provision of digital devices (tablets/smartphones)

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more characteristics of 4G technology and its applicability to higher education.
Learners can apply at least two real-time collaboration tools (cloud/hybrid conferencing) in mobile technology-based PBL projects.

Learners can write one analytical report on a social issue (e.g., digital divide) presented in a remote learning environment, utilizing three 4G-based video and AR contents (e.g., virtual field experience materials). The report must be approximately 500 characters, include at least three supporting materials (infographics/statistics), and meet at least four out of five evaluation rubric criteria.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
